Dear Sir/Maam,

 

Detailed Information for Getting a Transactional Route Account.

* You need to send us an Email after Registration (if you are not a registered user) stating What kind of SMS will be Sent (in Template Form mentioned on below mail) from Your Account & to Whom.

* After receiving your mail we will forward that to our Backend team for Checking the Eligibility whether the Sms Content stated is eligible for Transactional

* If Approved, We will share some Document with you which you need to Sign & Stamp on the Rs 100 Stamp Paper.

* After Receiving the Documents By you 1st you need to Send the Scanned copy to us on our Official mail Id I.E. business8@mvaayoo.com

*Once the Documents are received we will Create a new Account for you with open DND Route & the 6 DIGIT Sender ID you have opted for.

 

 

Template form:

Templates details for your reference: 

  Hi, the onetime verification code for <XXXX> is <XXXX>. Please enter this to verify you phone number in <XXXX>.

Note

         XXXX will be consider as a variable Data where it can be anything.

         Space also matter in templates creation and you can send only approved sms to your members.

 

Notice: Using Transactional account you are not authorized to send any type of greetings, Promotions, Wishes, Disocunts, Offers or Marketing campaign related messages, for this we suggest to send sms using Promotional route account where documents also not needed.

2229.html:
Introducing Floating IPs
We're excited to launch Floating IPs, a way to architect highly-available systems or applications on DigitalOcean!

Floating IPs help prevent single points of failure by allowing you to move one IP address between different Droplets in the same datacenter. This makes it possible to set up standby Droplets, ready to receive your production traffic at a moment’s notice.

Discover how to set up redundant load balancers that automatically failover with the help of this configuration tutorial. Additionally, Floating IPs can be used for application upgrades. Spin up a new Droplet, run the upgrades on the new Droplet, and switch the flow of traffic to the new Droplet.

Learn more about what Floating IPs are and how to use them on DigitalOcean with this tutorial.
Set Up Floating IPs
Also, check out our API documentation and the Ruby & Go wrappers that have been updated to support Floating IPs.

2294.html:
Up this month: JSON, webhooks, statistics, & taking Berlin.

Shopify for Designers #023


What do JSON, webhooks, statistics, and Berlin have in common? The answer is, of course, very little apart from them all being featured in issue 23 of this newsletter! In other news, 2016 is shaping up to be a great year with lots of exciting projects in the works that we'll share in the next few issues. Until next time — thanks for reading.
 


Shopify news

First things first. Here are a few updates from us:

  • Xero accounting app: Now available in UK, AUS, & NZ.
  • Featured blog image: Merchants now have the ability to add a featured image to a blog post. All themes must be updated to support this change; here's our updated Liquid documentation.
  • Shopify Buy Button: A great feature to offer Wordpress clients looking to make some holiday sales. Stay tuned — soon you'll be able to implement collections using our Buy Button.
 

Collections as JSON



I often get asked how to integrate Shopify into an existing web site, or how to allow customers to buy products from another domain. There are a few ways you can achieve this from adding in a Buy Button (as mentioned above), to using a cart permalink. There may well be occasions, however, where you want to display all the products from a collection automatically and have it update without manual intervention.

One approach is to use the power of JSON to import a collection into an existing web project and then iterate over each product and display the data however you see fit. Thankfully it’s easier than you might imagine to get a JSON representation of a collection — it’s as simple as adding /products.json to a collection URL. Here’s an example using the Pipeline theme demo:

Now that you are able to request a JSON representation of a collection, you can use the client or server-side technology of your choice to consume the data, loop over it extracting the desired data, and output it into your page.

Look out for a full tutorial on this approach on the Partners Blog in the coming weeks using JSON and PHP.

 

Have you tried Webhooks?



Whilst we are on a more technical note, I’d like to highlight the power of webhooks. A Webhook is a tool for retrieving and storing data from a certain event - a good example of this is a new order.

A simple example would be to take new order data and programmatically add it to your own custom database. Alternatively you could take inspiration from Craig at Five Simple Steps and use it to light up an LED.

All you need to do to create a webhook is register a URL in the Shopify admin that the data will be POSTed to once the chosen action has occurred. Again using your server side technology of choice you can consume the POST data and record it accordingly. Depending on your needs a webhook can often work in place of a fully fledged app API integration too.

We’re back on the road in the next few weeks. If you are attending any of the following events, please do come say hello and pick up a paper copy of our Grow book and, if you are lucky, one of our limited edition tin mugs.

 

Statistics



This might be a first for this newsletter — a quote from 19th century British politician Benjamin Disraeli!

“There are three types of lies — lies, damn lies, and statistics.”

Regardless of your own view of the value and importance of statistics, they make for very interesting reading. An article titled 100 Quick And Snackable eCommerce Statistics on the Visual Website Optimizer blog recently caught my eye.

For example, did you know that China is the biggest online spender, followed by the USA and the UK? Another interesting stat is that 44% of companies focus more on customer acquisition than on customer retention — however the probability of selling to an existing customer is 50 to 70%.

Beyond the “oh that’s interesting” factor, there are a number of sections which could help in your next client pitch. For example, according to the article, email marketing is still the best converting technique followed by social media. In contrast, websites represent the biggest source of new acquisitions. Being armed with some stats might just be the help you need to push your proposal over the line or inform your next strategy. That is, of course, if you don’t agree with Disraeli!

 

An Afternoon with Shopify in Berlin, Germany



Finally, if you are local to Berlin, join us at our afternoon event on Monday 2nd November. We’ve partnered up with Beyond Tellerrand once again and will be hosting a fun packed afternoon of talks and chat with special guests Alex O’Byrne from We Make Websites and Richard Wiggins from MK Geek Night.

Register for free!

Unsubscribe  |  View this email on the web  |  www.shopify.com/partners

Shopify  |  150 Elgin Street, Ottawa ON, K2P 1L4
